name: OpenClaw Manager
tagline: Programmatically provision new OpenClaw agents on DigitalOcean
description: A rig for spinning up new OpenClaw instances from an existing Linux machine. Uses doctl to create droplets, 1Password CLI to manage secrets, and SSH to configure the new agent. Designed to be run by an AI manager agent or a human with CLI access.

credits.name: OpenClaw
credits.description: Builds on the openclaw-droplet rig by marshellis. This rig automates the provisioning process for programmatic use by manager agents.

whatItDoes: Given an agent configuration file, this rig creates a new DigitalOcean droplet, installs OpenClaw, configures channels (Telegram, Gmail), and stores all secrets in 1Password. The manager reads shared secrets (like Anthropic API keys) from 1Password and creates agent-specific entries prefixed with the agent name. After provisioning, the new agent is running and reachable via its configured channels.
useCases: Spin up a new AI team member with one command
Manage a fleet of OpenClaw agents across projects
Reproducible agent provisioning with secrets in 1Password

prerequisites.name: Linux machine
prerequisites.description: The manager runs from an existing Linux box (e.g., another OpenClaw instance)

prerequisites.name: doctl
prerequisites.description: DigitalOcean CLI, authenticated with an API token

prerequisites.name: 1Password CLI (op)
prerequisites.description: Authenticated with access to the secrets vault

prerequisites.name: SSH key in DigitalOcean
prerequisites.description: An SSH key registered with DigitalOcean for droplet access

prerequisites.name: Anthropic API Key
prerequisites.description: Stored in 1Password (shared across agents or per-agent)

installerActions.label: Install manager tools
installerActions.detail: Installs doctl, op, and jq if not present. Verifies authentication for each.

verificationSteps.expectedResult: Agent-specific secrets are created with the correct prefix
